topic_metadata.title: Why am I getting unknown font family error for multiple packages?

posts.name: Abhirath Anand
posts.cooked: Hi, I’m new to Typst, and I’ve been trying to use the modern-cv template for my own CV. However, when I set up the template, I am getting certain package warnings in the Typst editor which seem to be font family related – this means that the icons for font awesome for GitHub and LinkedIn for example are not rendering correctly and I’m not sure how exactly I can resolve them. Any help in this matter would be greatly appreciated!
posts.raw:
Hi, I'm new to Typst, and I've been trying to use the `modern-cv` template for my own CV. However, when I set up the template, I am getting certain package warnings in the Typst editor which seem to be font family related – this means that the icons for font awesome for GitHub and LinkedIn for example are not rendering correctly and I'm not sure how exactly I can resolve them. Any help in this matter would be greatly appreciated!

![CleanShot 2025-04-28 at 13.00.50|238x371](upload://1VoDg4pOt4fmHUeO5nXpuDfXMKQ.png)

posts.cooked: Hi. The warning about missing fonts can be fixed by adding missing font files into the project. Other package-related warnings are usually due to something being outdated, so the only fix is to use a custom patched version of the package or ask the package author to fix them and make a new version.
posts.raw: Hi. The warning about missing fonts can be fixed by adding missing font files into the project. Other package-related warnings are usually due to something being outdated, so the only fix is to use a custom patched version of the package or ask the package author to fix them and make a new version.

posts.name: SillyFreak
posts.cooked:
See the readme: modern-cv – Typst Universe

Fonts

[…]

To use the fontawesome icons in the web app, add a fonts folder to your project and upload the otf files from the fontawesome download to this folder like so:

fontawesome – Typst Universe has more info on this too.
posts.raw:
See the readme: https://typst.app/universe/package/modern-cv

> ### Fonts
> 
> [...]
> 
> To use the fontawesome icons in the web app, add a `fonts` folder to your project and upload the `otf` files from the fontawesome download to this folder like so:

https://typst.app/universe/package/fontawesome has more info on this too.

posts.name: Abhirath Anand
posts.cooked: Thank you so much, this is incredibly helpful, I completely missed this!
posts.raw: Thank you so much, this is incredibly helpful, I completely missed this!
